headline: Stocks keep sliding as stimulus deal uncertainty persists. What Cramer and two others are watching
summary: Worries around a stimulus deal getting done and coronavirus case count spikes overseas are putting pressure on U.S. stocks, but CNBC's Jim Cramer and others have their sights set elsewhere.

headline: ‘No doubt’ that crucial U.S. fiscal stimulus is coming, IMF managing director says
summary: Kristalina Georgieva, the managing director of the International Monetary Fund, told CNBC Thursday that she has "no doubt" the U.S. will implement a new economic stimulus package that will help reduce the current uncertainties for the global economy.
Private investment in space companies in the third quarter bounced back after a significant dip, according to a Space Capital report.
headline: Investment in space companies bounced back in the third quarter from the COVID-19 lull, report says
Buy Box Experts Partner on E-Commerce (Podcast)

summary: If you begin now, you can save $1 million, $2 million or $3 million with the right amount of time and dedication. How much you'll need to save every month will depend on how old you are when you start saving and how much money you want for retirement.
headline: How much you need to invest every month to retire with $1 million to $3 million, broken down by age
Fed's Quarles sees need for more reforms to short-term funding markets
summary: Short-term funding markets seized up during the early days of the coronavirus pandemic, demonstrating that more reform is needed, the Federal Reserve's chief banking overseer said Thursday.

headline: YouTube tightens rules on conspiracy videos, but stops short of banning QAnon
summary: YouTube told CNBC that it doesn't consider QAnon a monolithic entity that can be banned — but one that has sprawling tentacles sometimes interwoven with truth or gray areas.
United Airlines CEO expects a long path to recovery without a vaccine, which he expects at the end of next year.
headline: United Airlines CEO: 'We've turned the corner,' but travel demand to remain weak for months more

summary: Facebook and Twitter gave different reasons and methods of reducing distribution of the Post story, which the Biden campaign has rebutted.
headline: Facebook and Twitter CEOs will have to answer to Senate Republicans after Biden NY Post story controversy

summary: "I think we're importing their negativity. I don't think it's necessarily going to last," CNBC's Jim Cramer said on Thursday morning.
headline: Cramer says investors will regret selling U.S. stocks on coronavirus spikes in Europe

summary: America's malls' future prospects — fulfillment centers, apartment complexes, schools or medical offices — could mean massive write-offs in property values, according to a new Barclays report.
headline: Turning a dead mall into a warehouse will slash its value as much as 90%, Barclays predicts
This Amazon program is helping people get training, certification and jobs in cloud computing
summary: The AWS re/Start program partners with local workforce development groups to provide free cloud training, certification and job placement for graduates to start a new career in technology.

headline: Alphabet is trialing solar-paneled, robotic buggies to inspect farm crops
summary: The vehicles can collect a large amount of data for analysis.

headline: France and the Netherlands call for tough EU powers to curb Big Tech
summary: France and the Netherlands have proposed stricter EU rules to oversee large technology firms, such as Alphabet, Facebook and Amazon.

headline: DraftKings strikes another media partnership, this time with AT&T's Turner Sports
summary: DraftKings will integrate its content across Turner Sports platforms, but the agreement excludes the NBA.

headline: These stocks trading at discounts to their valuations may be worth buying, traders say
summary: Two traders sift through a group of stocks "on sale" to find bargain buys in the market.
As Europe introduces more and more restrictive measures to curb the spread of the coronavirus, full-scale lockdowns should be a "very, very last resort."
headline: Full lockdowns should be a 'very, very last resort' and can be avoided, WHO's Europe chief says
Morgan Stanley is set to report third-quarter earnings – here’s what the Street expects
summary: CEO James Gorman has doubled down on his push to diversify away from Morgan Stanley’s traditional strengths of trading and investment banking.
Twitter has confirmed it is going to start removing posts that deny the Holocaust from its platform just days after Facebook implemented the same policy.
headline: Twitter follows Facebook on removing posts that deny the Holocaust

summary: Washington is trying to put Ant Group on the U.S. Entity List, Reuters reported. But with the company's on the domestic market and very little business outside, a blacklisting is likely to have little impact.
headline: U.S. reportedly explores sanctions on China's Ant Group. Analysts say they'll be 'largely symbolic'
